etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the department of a household concerned with kitchen utensils): from Old French escuelerie, from escuele ‘dish’, from Latin scutella ‘salver’, diminutive of scutra ‘wooden platter’

definitions: a small kitchen or room at the back of a house used for washing dishes and other dirty household work.
shortDefinitions: small kitchen or room at back of house used for washing dishes and other dirty household work
